main event: A County Sheriff's Deputy and a female companion spotted a bright, silvery, circular object in the sky near Jamestown, California on April 6, 1955.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be at an altitude of about 5,000 feet.,It appeared to hover and then moved rapidly to the north.,Witnesses described it as being about 50-75 feet in diameter.,The object made no noise and left no trail.,It was concluded to be definitely a weather balloon.
witness description: a County Sheriff's Deputy and a female companion
